intro: Hieracium saxifragum subsp. guillonianum, commonly known as the Guillon’s hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, often in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in early summer. It is characterized by its finely divided leaves and a flowering stem that bears several flower heads. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and localized species.
